text.p: ON Technology Corp said Tuesday it is exiting the anti-virus business, realigning its corporate strategy and has hired Herman DeLatte to be its president and chief executive.

As part of the new strategy, ON said it is laying off about 100 employees and expects to take nonrecurring restructuring and inventory charges of between $6.5 million and $7.5 million pre-tax in the third quarter.
DeLatte, formerly the chief operating officer of Micrografx Inc, succeeds Christopher Risley, who will continue to serve on the board.
In addition, the board elected William Hulley as its chairman. Hulley has served on the ON board since 1994 and is a founding partner of Adams Capital Management.
The company said that it is realigning its corporate strategy and organization to focus on the growth of its new enterprise client management software business.

To provide resources for the client management effort, ON said it is exiting the anti-virus business and is focusing on better serving existing customers in its groupware, network management and security businesses.
"Reducing investment in trial development will allow us to focus our development and support efforts on the needs of existing customers," Risley said in a statement.
